result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Allen Coerper

defendant.name: Coerper, Brandon Allen
defendant.address: 13217 W Gurno Lake Rd, Hayward, WI 54843

records.addlTxt:
11:04 AM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Brandon Allen Coerper appeared by video from Sawyer Co. Jail, in custody.  Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video for Brandon Allen Coerper.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. Def and counsel are satisfied to proceed by Zoom. State calls Deputy Eckes - S&T. CT finds identification made. Cross by Atty Taber. CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial. ARGN: Def is preserved 15 days on prearraignment rights. Reading waived. Plea NG. Bond cont. 11:14 am adj.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion. Not to possess or use drugs without a prescription or drug paraphernalia.

12:52 PM Defendant Brandon Allen Coerper appeared by video, in custody.   Holly Wood Webster appearing for the State.  Atty Donna Burger appearing in person.     AW-clerk.   Atty Burger does qualify.  DE rec'd  CC.  State addresses court. Atty Burger Reading waive.  Waive time limits.  CT-set bond.  1:39 pm adj.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
